page.title: 05TOWN CENTRE INVERURIE
page.content:
The Town Hall was built in the Italian style of architecture in 1862. Two years ago it was refurbished and now has a lovely hall, in which various entertainments are held, and small meeting rooms.
The libray is at the side of the Town Hall and the museum is above the library. The library is called the Carnegie Library after Andrew Carnegie who gave the money to build it. The museum contains items of local interest.
An Advice and Information Centre is situated nearby in the High Street. It is open on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 10a.m. to 12 noon and from 2p.m. to 4p.m.
